experience: You and Robert both know Hector Botero, Keith Rezendes, and 11 others

My responsibilities as PMO Business Analyst and Project Manager include but are not limited to the collection of lines of business requirements, preparation of process flows and supplemental specifications, vendor analysis, ad-hoc reporting, Executive reporting, data verification and user acceptance testing. I have also managed and led cross-functional projects that encompass all aspects of the mortgage services industry to ensure investor and regulatory compliance, effectiveness and timeliness of implementation.

My responsibilities included but were not limited to the collection of end-user requirements, preparation of specifications, attaining vendor estimates, writing ad-hoc SQL scripts, creating line of business reports, performing data verification and acceptance testing. I then worked with Project Teams to validate the effectiveness and correctness of changes to further manage the migration of application deliverables into production. These projects made significant efficiency improvements in business processes and reporting efficiencies. Some specific duties include:• Authored policy and procedure documents, change controls and validation protocols • Developed business application modifications and led Project Teams for production implementations• Served as System Administrator for Trackwise, Oracle E-Business Suite (11i), ClearOrbit Barcode Systems• Developed Oracle Process Manufacturing (OPM) Computer Based Trainings for company personnel including Oracle Purchasing, OPM Inventory, OPM Product Development, OPM Materials Requirement Planning, OPM Production Management, OPM Quality Management and OPM Manufacturing Accounting and Cost Management• Developed and presented Oracle Process Manufacturing, Barcode and Noetix WebQuery hands on classes to colleagues, management and directors• Provided 2nd Level day to day support (24/7) including investigating, resolving and/or escalating business application problems • Supported business systems auditing, testing and maintenance including compliance with Sarbanes Oxley, business ethics, legal, and FDA GxP validation where appropriate
Business Analyst, Programmer Analyst and Management Trainee

My responsibilities at Cintas emphasized the design, development, validation testing and installation of real-time processes across product handling, sortation, cleaning and re-distribution. Some specific duties included:• Gathered user requirements and created result sets using MS SQL and Business Intelligence reports via COGNOS • Fulfilled time-sensitive requests by Management to define, analyze, measure, control and implement ideas for improving manufacturing efficiency • Documented functional and technical requirements using Caliber and Star Team to keep all enhancements current and detail new project • Defined, documented, developed and coordinated the Rental Team’s Disaster Recovery test requirements then validated that all Quick Test Professional and Quality Center scripts were implemented successfully• Drafted in-depth test plans and developed computerized testing to create operational requests based on future business requirements and strategies• Prepared timely and accurate project estimates, functional and technical specifications to support requirements defined by R&D for network based client-server applications • Developed new, modified existing, and enhanced software applications using Visual Basic, MQ Series, iCONICS, iFIX and SQL Server for diverse plant automation applications• Conducted unit testing of application modules to ensure applications met specifications• Administered and maintained Inventory Management Systems (e.g., purchasing, receiving, deployment, installation and configuration) • Prepared presentations to provide comprehensive systems and software training for Management, Production and Hotline/Help Desk/Support Partners • Prepared and maintained documentation to answer end user, operations, and technical questions about systems software and hardware• Provided 24/7 day to day support including investigating, resolving and/or escalating problems for Rental and Industrial Automation Systems

Under a teaching contract with the City of Middletown, I performed the following functions:• Planned and developed the curriculum and associated classroom-training manuals for introductory computer systems and software classes • Provided classroom training, documentation, hardware and software support, along with mentoring graduates
Bachelor of Science in Business Administration
Student Advisory Council Member (1995 – 1996), Computer Club Representative (1995 – 1996), Intramural Basketball (1995 – 1999)

While at Miami I was a Computer Program Operator/Instructor (1994 – 1996), Veterans Representative (1996 – 1998) and Business Technology and M.I.S Tutor (1996 – 1998). Honors: Scholastic Honors, Student Leadership and Entrepreneurship Awards

Darin Conrad
Lean Coordinator at SEEPEX Inc
March 8, 2010, Darin worked with Robert in different groups

I thoroughly enjoy the opportunity of working with Robert Coffey.  During our time at Alkermes, I have worked in management for the Production Department.  After meeting Robert and finding out how knowledgeable and well-versed he is as a Systems Analyst, I began sharing my efficiency challenges in terms of productivity and optimizing processes.  Robert immediately discussed different methods which he had experience, as well as, sharing techniques used by others that he had worked with in the past.  We immediately identified the root cause of the problem and selected methods to increase my group’s operational output by eliminating redundancy and clearly identifying our process.	Additionally, I have seen Robert’s dynamic approach and work output as a part of a cross-functional team.  Recently, he was a part of a team seeking to improve efficiency in the team’s output to better meet the customers’ needs.  Robert quickly helped define the issue and discussed methods to reduce the opportunity of operator error through numerous entries.  Furthermore, the group consisted of several personnel that worked offsite at our company’s headquarters.  The group did not encounter issues that can normally plague a group at two different sites mainly because of Robert’s initiative to ensure all personnel could provide inputs from a wide array of professional backgrounds.  Robert utilized the skills and assets that he brought to the table within the group and quickly helped galvanize this team to focus on and resolve the issues they were looking to remedy.  As a result the team minimized entry errors through use of a newly validated system and produced a much more compliant system that increased productivity by 75%!	I strongly recommend Robert Coffey as a professional who can contribute in any organization on any team.  He is a tremendous teacher, as well as a skilled Systems Analyst expert:  A consummate professional.

summary: Over the last 16 years I've been fortunate to have built a diverse background in solving a myriad of problems facing the business community today. My experience base ranges from solving real time industrial automation, manufacturing and/or mortgage servicing problems which provide turn-key operations in the planning, implementation, verification and maintenance for rental, pharmaceutical, manufacturing and mortgage servicing business environments.The most rewarding aspect of my career has been the sense of accomplishment I feel in exceeding customer or management expectations in leading or being a member of project teams that provide on-time, workable solutions to vexing business problems. I love to apply hands-on experience to determine requirements, select, apply and develop the appropriate information system and architecture technology and where possible, test and support the resulting product. With a goal of achieving extraordinary customer and team relations I enjoy collaborating with people and working in different environments. In particular I love to help train employees as well as learn new information languages and architectures.  I also take pride in being able to work well under pressure to meet deadlines, including the management of multiple projects. I believe I have been highly successful in interfacing with customers at all levels to correctly interpret customer needs and build successful strategies that produce strong results. I also believe I am an excellent communicator in presenting plans, progress and solutions to management.  Other aspects of my background:• US Navy / Persian Gulf War Veteran• Graduated with Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science from Miami University of Oxford, Ohio• Skilled in developing, instructing and implementing standardized policies and procedures• Reliable, highly motivated, passionate, tech-savvy and driven to excelSpecialties: Project Management, Team Leadership, Business Requirement Gathering, Process Improvement, Disaster Recovery, Software Development, Test Planning (Unit, Integration, Regression and User Acceptance Testing), Change Management, Systems Validation, Standard Operating Procedure Development, End User Training, Coaching
name: Robert Coffey
title: PMO Business Analyst at PNC Mortgage
